article_title: Nonprofit unveils plan to build health care bus in Sen. Pinckney’s name
article_text:
The Palmetto Palace will host a cornhole tournament on Saturday to raise money for the Clementa Pinckney health care unit.

The event will be held at the Elks Lodge in West Ashley.

The entry fee is $40 for each team of two players.

Registration for the tournament may be completed online, www.thepalmettopalace.com.

To make a tax-deductible donation to The Palmetto Palace, visit the nonprofit’s website, www.thepalmettopalace.com, or call 532-3169.

og.description: The late Sen. Clementa Pinckney couldn’t persuade his fellow state lawmakers to expand Medicaid eligibility under the Affordable Care Act, but his vision to improve health care access in rural communities may be realized early next year.
